product_metadata.title: ₹75 Lakh Term Insurance Plan
product_metadata.target_audience: Primary earners, individuals with loans, parents, planning retirement

product_summary.objective: To provide life insurance coverage of ₹75 Lakh to protect the family's financial future.
highlights: Tax Benefits up to ₹46,800 under Section 80C
Online discount of 6% for regular premium payment

plan_variants.description: Pure term insurance with death benefit.
Premiums paid are refunded on maturity if the insured survives the policy tenure.

core_benefits.description: Sum assured of ₹75 Lakh paid to the nominee if the insured passes away during the policy tenure.
No benefit under normal term plans. Return of Total Premiums Paid available under Return of Premium variant.
Premiums eligible for deduction under Section 80C. Death benefit tax-free under Section 10(10D).

policy_term_options: Whole life coverage (up to 99/100 years) available

discounts: 5% Discount for first individual life insurance policy

services: Network Discounts on Medicines and Lab Bookings

compliance_rules.fraud_warning: BEWARE of spurious phone calls and fraudulent offers. IRDAI does not sell policies or announce bonuses.
compliance_rules.tax_disclaimer: Tax benefits are subject to provisions of Section 80C and Section 10(10D) of the Income Tax Act, 1961. Consult your tax advisor.

retrieval_chunks.text: A ₹75 lakh term insurance plan offers a sum assured of ₹75 lakhs paid as death benefit if the insured passes away. It offers financial stability to the family.
Get life cover of ₹75 Lakh starting at ₹17/day. Includes options for regular, limited, or single premium payment frequencies.
The plan offers a Return of Premium option where total premiums paid are refunded if the life assured survives the policy tenure.
Enhance coverage with riders like Critical Illness, Accidental Death Benefit, and Waiver of Premium for nominal extra cost.
Premiums are tax-deductible up to ₹1.5 lakh under Section 80C. Death benefits are tax-free under Section 10(10D).
Suitable for primary earners, individuals with loans, parents, and those planning retirement.
